content.description: Start: 20 feet left of Ph.D. at an incipient crack.   Climb up the overhanging wall following the incipient crack.   Note: This route was named after Leith Wain
content.location: 20 feet left of Ph.D. at an incipient crack.

content.description: Start: 10 feet left of Ph.D. at a crack.   Climb the overhanging wall following the crack.
content.location: 10 feet left of Ph.D. at a crack.

content.description: There is "Post-PhD Left" and "Post-PhD Right"... why not Post-PhD Direct? This one isn't in the PATC guide, but seems worth adding. For this climb, use the same start as the "Post" climbs and pull the roof *without* using the flake on the left of the roof or the crack on the right. It's a bit more difficult than Post-PhD Left, but still feels about 5.10-.Â
content.location: Below the left edge of a rectangular overhang, 10 feet right of Ph.D.

content.description: Start: Below the left edge of a rectangular overhang, 10 feet right of Ph.D.
content.location: Below the left edge of a rectangular overhang, 10 feet right of Ph.D.

content.description: Start: 20 feet right of Ph.D. at a crack leading to the right side of a rectangular overhang.   Follow crack up right side of the overhang.
content.location: 20 feet right of Ph.D. at a crack leading to the right side of a rectangular overhang.

content.description: Start: In the center of the overhanging wall of Cupid's Bower is a large crack with triangular and coffin shaped recesses.   Climb the crack.
content.location: In the center of the overhanging wall of Cupid's Bower is a large crack with triangular and coffin shaped recesses.

content.description: Start: At the base of a left facing corner 50 feet right of Ph.D.   Climb the corner.
content.location: At the base of a left facing corner 50 feet right of Ph.D.

content.description: Start: Approximately 75 feet right of Ph.D.   Climb up the crack through a small overhang.   At 5.3 its not even worth setting up, I'm just mentioning it because its name continues on the theme. Who knows, maybe someone will do a cool variation - the naming theme still has some cool possiblilities open..

Cupids Bower is located on the downstream end of Sherwin Island.  The usual approach to this outcrop is from Old Angler's Inn Parking area. Hike upstream along the tow path for a 1/4 mile.  At this point it is possible to see a broken cement culverts in the river.  take the path leading down to the culvert.  At the culvert, cross the river as best able, and follow the trails on Sherwin Island downstream.  Cupid's Bower is set back nearly 200 feets from the downstream tip of the island.
